intro: Euphrasia collina subsp. diemenica, commonly known as the Diemen's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Tasmania. It is a low-growing herb with slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understoreys. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a hairy surface. The species is part of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes several parasitic and non-parasitic plants.
